Good then, to know I am not the only one actively working on more 
scenarios.  Currently, I am working on a single scenario that is cash 
rich and enemy poor outside of the ones I am creating to be played on. 
  The goal of that scenario is to make it very easy for me to raise 
tons of money to create characters of experience level 100 and higher. 
 In fact, I have put level 20,007 gold in that scenario.  
Unfortunately, it did not give me enough money to bring an archer upto 
experience level beyond 155.  But, on the other hand, my theory about 
armor level equaling the product of strength times experience level 
for archers gives me sufficient protection from damage by my own 
weapons.

I need a little help in making some of my newer scenarios more 
realistic, specifically, the ones that occur in the ocean.  Yes, I am 
worked my way creating scenarios 116 to 132.  I still lack, umm, 4 
scenarios in my current cycle.  Then, I will play test them, fix them, 
and start working on another cycle of scenarios.

I have a quick question that will effect the development of scenarios 
in my next cycle:  does anyone want to attempt to take on mages (who 
can freeze time) and archmages (who can mind control) whose experience 
levels are higher than 15?  I am not inclined to use such opponents 
because of the potential extreme difficulty in defeating them 
(archmage mind controls your whole team or mage does severe damage 
while time is frozen).  If you do not speak up, those opponents will 
not show up in my next cycle.

--- In gladiator@egroups.com, "Donna Der" <TheLegendaryLight@w...> 
wrote:
